title: Bug 23935 - Text widget with Tree parent does not lose focus
description: Both widgets are children of the shell. The right tree and text only work on Windows. We can probably work around by creating the text editor as a sibling of the tree and moving it above the tree.
OB: When clicking anywhere in the tree, the tree gains focus. However, on Linux, the text never loses focus when clicking on the tree. This is because the text widget is a child of the tree, which causes platform UI bug 2470.
EB: When running the code (build 20020920), the left tree and text behave correctly on both Windows and Linux.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the attached code.
2. Click anywhere in the tree widget.
3. Observe that the tree gains focus and the text does not lose focus (only on Linux).

Expected behavior:
- The tree should not gain focus when clicking on it.
- The text should lose focus when clicking on the tree, similar to Windows behavior.
